text.section: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section or otherwise required by law, information provided to the Secretary under § 8-1001(b)(3) of this title for purposes of determining whether a claimant left employment as a result of domestic violence shall be confidential and not subject to disclosure to any party.

section.section: The Secretary may notify the employing unit in general terms that a claimant has left employment as a result of domestic violence.

The Secretary may not disclose information provided to the Secretary under § 8-1001(b)(3)(ii) of this title to the employing unit unless the employing unit can establish that:
the employing unit has a legitimate need to question the veracity of the information;
the employing unit's need for the information outweighs the claimant's personal privacy interest; and
the employing unit is unable to obtain the information from any other source.

Before disclosing information under this section, the Secretary shall:
notify the claimant; and
redact unnecessary identifying information.
An employing unit that receives information under this section may not further disseminate the information.

text.section: Information related to the status of a claimant or a claimant's spouse, minor child, or parent as a victim of domestic violence is not public information subject to disclosure as part of the appeals process.
The Secretary may adopt regulations to further protect the privacy of the claimant.
